definition: to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
surgeon/as opposed to physician 內科醫生|内科医生[nei4 ke1 yi1 sheng1], who works primarily by administering drugs
medical doctor/physician who works primarily by administering drugs, as opposed to surgeon 外科醫生|外科医生[wai4 ke1 yi1 sheng1]

pinyin: zheng3 xing2 wai4 ke1 yi1 sheng1

definition: Médecins Sans Frontières (MSF charity)/Doctors Without Borders

pinyin: ji3 zhui1 zhi3 ya1 zhi4 liao2 yi1 sheng1

sentences.english: He distrusted doctors, and often had Don check his blood pressure.
sentences.chinese: 他不信任醫生，常叫唐幫他量血壓。

sentences.english: All his life, Dr Huang served the people.
sentences.chinese: 黃醫生爲人民服務了一輩子。

sentences.english: The doctor burst a blood vessel.
sentences.chinese: 醫生使一條血管破裂了。

sentences.english: An army of doctors blitzed the disease .
sentences.chinese: 一大批醫生對這種疾病發起猛攻。

sentences.english: If pregnant, take an iron supplement, as recommended by an obstetrician or other health care provider.
sentences.chinese: 如懷孕，要在婦產醫生的指導下食用補鐵的食物。

sentences.english: Hong Kong Dr. Lucilly Hung treats many patients with the help of acupuncture.
sentences.chinese: 香港洪魯西醫生用針具治療了許多病人。

sentences.english: 'The longer you've known someone, the easier that conversation is, ' Dr. Epperly adds.
sentences.chinese: 艾伯利醫生說，你認識病患越久，這種對話就越容易。

sentences.english: Placebos work, doctors believed, because the mind is a powerful thing.
sentences.chinese: 醫生們相信安慰劑起作用，是因爲念力是一種力量。

sentences.english: A doctor was having an affair with his nurse.
sentences.chinese: 有位醫生，常跟科室裏的女護士鬼混。

sentences.english: And when it was made plain who Kino was, the doctor grew stern and judicious at the same time.
sentences.chinese: 弄清楚誰是吉納後，醫生變得嚴肅認真而又明智起來。

sentences.english: But that doctor may also use value-laden language to describe the options.
sentences.chinese: 但是醫生也會使用具有價值取向的語言描述這些選項。

sentences.english: The physician made a prescription against seasickness for him.
sentences.chinese: 醫生給他開了個治暈船的藥方。

sentences.english: The profession and the public do not appreciate that advertising claims come without proof in the case of diets.
sentences.chinese: 醫生同業和大衆沒有察知廣告所宣稱的飲食並無論證。

sentences.english: The doctor diagnosed my illness as neuralgia.
sentences.chinese: 醫生診斷我的病是神經痛。

sentences.english: The doctors tell me that's what has knocked my digestion out being so infernally jealous of her.
sentences.chinese: 醫生們說我消化不良就是因爲我對她嫉妒得太厲害啦。

sentences.english: Dr. Webb says people did not trust the clinic at first.
sentences.chinese: 韋伯醫生說，最開始人們不信任這家診所。

definition: to press charges/to file a complaint
only/merely/no more than/but/however/anyway (to get back to a previous topic)/cannot be more (after adjectival)
medicine/drug/substance used for a specific purpose (e.g. poisoning, explosion, fermenting)/CL:種|种[zhong3],服[fu4],味[wei4]/to poison
